maml:description.maml:para: Creates enrypted password file
Will prompt for password and write encrypted password to file Encryption key is generated based on current windows user security token
Path to location of encrypted password file
Filename of enrypted password file
Path to location of encrypted password file
Filename of enrypted password file
Path and Filename are required input strings
New-PasswordFile does not generate any output

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet is used allow the use of basic authentication and persist an encrypted password to a file

maml:description.maml:para: Get password from encrypted password file
Read password from encrypted file Encryption key is based on windows user security token of logged on user when file was created
Full file path of encrypted password file

maml:alert.maml:para: This cmdlet is used allow the use of basic authentication and retrieve a password from an encrypted file

maml:description.maml:para: Disable certificate validation
Ignore SSL errors - This is not needed if the proper CA cert is installed on client.
Set XtremIO Connection Information
Stores XtremIO REST API connection and authentication information
Account username to authenticate to XtremIO REST API Service
Full path to encrypted password file for API user
Host Name or IP Address of XMS server
Credential object used to authenticate to XtremIO REST API
Host Name or IP Address of XMS server
Account username to authenticate to XtremIO REST API Service
Full path to encrypted password file for API user
Host Name or IP Address of XMS server
Credential object used to authenticate to XtremIO REST API

Supply Username and full path to encrypted Password File
Hostname is also passed as a string
Username and Password is supplied as credential

Sets the following global variables used to connect and authenticate to XtremIO REST API
$Global:BaseUri $Global:EncodedPassword

dev:remarks.maml:para: Uses encrypted password file created with New-PasswordFile cmdlet
Supply credential object and hostname for connection to XtremIO REST API

maml:description.maml:para: Get XtremIO API Types Information
Get XtremIO API Types Information
No input is required
Returns object with API type names and uri paths
Get XtremIO Item list
Get XtremIO Item list
Retrieve performance information for XtremIO Object
Retrieve performance information for XtremIO Object

Type of object to retrieve performance information
Will provide a choice for the following set of values
'Initiator','DataProtectionGroup','Volume','Cluster','InitiatorGroup','SSD','Target'
The begining of the time period to show data records
The end of the time period to show data records
List of objects for which data will be returned

Specifies counter interval granularity to retrieve
Optional values('one_minute','ten_minutes','one_hour','one_day','auto','raw')
Specify maximum number of records to be returned

List of properties to show.
The available properties will depend on entity type

Cluster ID of cluster to retrieve cluster information
Note: This is meant to accept name or ID, but the REST API seems to have an issue with name on this object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will return a psobject with performance information for the 'lab-datastore' at an interval of 1 hour for the time period specified
This will return a psobject with 'avg__iops','avg__rd_iops','avg__wr_iops' for the 'lab_datastore' volume at an interval of 1 hour for the time period specified
